# R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}

library(dplyr)
library(ggmap)
library(ggplot2)

nola <- read.csv("data/HGP/nola.csv")

# Set bounds of map
minlat <- min(nola$lat)
minlon <- min(nola$lon)
maxlat <- max(nola$lat)
maxlon <- max(nola$lon)

# Create background for map image
NOLAmap <- get_map(
    location = c(minlon, minlat, maxlon, maxlat), 
    zoom = 13, 
    col = "bw")

storemap <- ggmap(NOLAmap) + 
	geom_point(
		data = nola, 
        aes(x = long, y = lat, col = factor(street)), 
        alpha = 0.5) +
    scale_colour_brewer(
        name = "",
        labels = c("St Charles Ave", "S Carrollton Ave", "St Claude Ave"),
        palette = "Set1") +
	ggtitle("Location of all stores in dataset") +
    theme(
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        legend.position="bottom")


  

summary(cars)
fit <- lm(dist ~ speed, data = cars)
fit
```
